result.value: A three-dimensional two-phase flow solver, SedFoam, has been developed for sediment transport applications. The solver is extended from twoPhaseEulerFoam available in the 2.1.0 release of the open-source CFD (computational fluid dynamics) toolbox OpenFOAM. In this approach the sediment phase is modeled as a continuum, and constitutive laws have to be prescribed for the sediment stresses. In the proposed solver, two different intergranular stress models are implemented: the kinetic theory of granular flows and the dense granular flow rheology μ(I). For the fluid stress, laminar or turbulent flow regimes can be simulated and three different turbulence models are available for sediment transport: a simple mixing length model (one-dimensional configuration only), a k − ε, a classical k − ω and a k − ω from Wilcox (2006).
This repository provides the SedFoam solver.
The sedfoam solver is in development and is not yet fully functional.

A three-dimensional two-phase flow solver, SedFoam, has been developed for sediment transport applications. The solver is extended from twoPhaseEulerFoam available in the 2.1.0 release of the open-source CFD (computational fluid dynamics) toolbox OpenFOAM. In this approach the sediment phase is modeled as a continuum, and constitutive laws have to be prescribed for the sediment stresses. In the proposed solver, two different intergranular stress models are implemented: the kinetic theory of granular flows and the dense granular flow rheology μ(I). For the fluid stress, laminar or turbulent flow regimes can be simulated and three different turbulence models are available for sediment transport: a simple mixing length model (one-dimensional configuration only), a k − ε, a classical k − ω and a k − ω from Wilcox (2006).

result.name: Release 2412
result.description:
## What's Changed
* debug docker_nb by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/193
* Publications list update + simplify the README by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/197
* Minor corrections in the documentation + adding the contribution of excess fluid pressure in writeOuput by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/199
* Turbulence model hybrid SAS by @alban3 in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/200
* Add vegetation solver by @remichassagne in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/201
* non-dimensional solution formulation and tutorials by @ggiamagas in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/202
* Correct Tuto and test 1DBedLoadTurb by @remichassagne in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/203
* Favre average Tke budget by @dralmanohar in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/204
* update CI 2406 --> 2412 by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/208
* restoring 0_org files by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/210
* Minor modif in Allrun tutorial 2DCylinderGranularFlow by @remichassagne in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/211
* update publications list by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/212

## New Contributors
* @alban3 made their first contribution in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/200
* @ggiamagas made their first contribution in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/202
* @dralmanohar made their first contribution in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/204

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/compare/2312...2412

result.name: Release 2312
result.description:
New version related to the Eduard Puigmontella OpenFoam journal paper (doi to come)

## What's Changed
* Develop by @jchauchat in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/176
* Replace nuFraExp to nuFra in UEqns.H by @remichassagne in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/180
* tutorial corrections by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/185
* Granular phase momentum budget by @remichassagne in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/184
* Adding extension OverSedDyMfoam by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/187
* update tutorials scripts and doc by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/188
* doc correction by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/190
* Develop by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/189


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/compare/2212...2312

result.name: Release 2212
result.description:
New version related to https://doi.org/10.1017/jfm.2023.335

## What's Changed
* PCG solver + shape factor + corrections by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/158
* update doc by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/159
* update docker by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/160
* debug docker notebook by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/161
* update doc docker by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/162
* circle-ci --> github action  by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/165
* adding Engelund dragModel and correction of messages that pop up when typos are made by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/166
* small things for the doc by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/168
* Update of the kinetic theory by @remichassagne in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/169
* debug docker notebook by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/170
* Small modifications + granular collapse tutorials by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/171
* Dockerfile: add python3-venv and meld by @paugier in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/173
* corrections tutorials - update 2212 - nutMax by @puigmontella in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/174
* New release : 2212 version by @CyrilleBonamy in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/175

## New Contributors
* @paugier made their first contribution in https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/pull/173

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/SedFoam/sedfoam/compare/3.3...2212

result.name: Release 3.2
result.description:
docker add
dilatency
extended kinetic theory
...

result.name: Release 3.1
result.description:
New features are more tutorials, more testing inside CI, and an extended version of kineticTheory.
This is the last release before the adding the dilatancy model

result.name: Release 3.0
result.description:
The new features are a new algorithm considering the reduced pressure and thus the improvement of the stability.
This version is compatible with the version 5.0 of the "classical" openfoam (from openfoam.org) and with the version v1712 and v1806 of the "plus" openfoam (from openfoam.com).

result.name: Release 2.0
result.description:
This release provides the sedfoam source code used in the Geoscientific Model Development manuscript : https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-2017-101

Openfoam version support : 2.4.0

result.title: sedfoam

result.value:
The sedfoam solver should be referenced using the GMD paper :

Julien Chauchat, Zhen Cheng, Tim Nagel, Cyrille Bonamy, and Tian-Jian Hsu (2017) SedFoam-2.0: a 3-D two-phase flow numerical model for sediment transport (Geosci. Model Dev., 10, 4367-4392) [![DOI](https://img.shields.io/badge/DOI-10.5195%2Fgmd_10_4367_2017-blue.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-10-4367-2017)

and the reference in which a specific configuration and/or feature has been first presented (please see list of references in the documentation).

If you are using a sedFoam version without modification, you should also refer to the Zenodo DOI of the version, current version is [![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.836642.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.836642)

```bash
cd $WM_PROJECT_USER_DIR
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/sedfoam/sedfoam sedfoam
cd sedfoam
./Allwclean
./Allwmake
```
There are tutorials located in `tutorials` and details can be found [here.](http://sedfoam.github.io/sedfoam)

*   Ali Salimi-Tarazouj
*   Hugo Divel
*   Pablo Higuera

[OpenFOAM](https://www.openfoam.com) is the free, open source CFD
software developed primarily by OpenCFD Ltd since 2004.
The OpenFOAM trademark is owned by OpenCFD Ltd.
